fields.description: Characters in Global Variable name are limited to 'alphanumeric'. Some naming conventions require using underscore '_' characters and I believe it shall be possible in Global Variable name.
fields.summary: Allow underscore '_' character in Global Variable name

fields.description:
as opposed to specifying |clean install| as goals in a build plan which leads to
$ mvn clean install

the maven targets should be separated so there are 2 or more iteration of maven: |clean \| install | which would lead to:
$ mvn clean
$ mvn install

This ensures that all modules are cleaned before the install. Otherwise clean install is run on a module by module basis.
fields.summary: execute "mvn clean" and "mvn install" separately in build plan

fields.description:
Clicking on the help link in the top right of bamboo takes you to the a useless page.  It says pretty much nothing and links you to the forums.

This page should either be fixed up to be accurate and point the user towards confluence, or even skip the intermediary and go straight to confluence.
fields.summary: Bamboo Header Help Link not so helpful

fields.description: I notice that JIRA has a link to Atlassian.com online documentation right in the web page header. It would be nice if Bamboo also offered this feature.
fields.summary: Include link to Bamboo Documentation Home in page header

fields.description:
Maven spits out a log line every few ks when downloading / uploading artifacts

{noformat}
Downloading: https://m2proxy.atlassian.com/repository/internal//com/atlassian/bamboo/atlassian-bamboo-agent-core/2.1/atlassian-bamboo-agent-core-2.1.jar
4/79K
8/79K
...
73/79K
77/79K
78/79K
79/79K
79K downloaded
{noformat}

This generally pollutes the logs and should be filtered out
fields.summary: Maven download logs should be filtered

fields.description:
I have configured the instant messaging server as specified here:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO011/6.3.1+Configuring+Bamboo+to+use+Google+Talk+for+Instant+Messaging

I have ensured that the accounts can send messages to each other through regular Google talk.

I get the following error:

XMPP Error encountered while attempting to send message: XMPPError connecting to talk2.l.google.com:5222.
fields.summary: IM not working with Google Talk

fields.description:
If you have an export that was exported whilst connected to external user management..

You can NOT import this data while connected to your external user management.  E.g you need to start bamboo up with the normal user management (internal), do the import, then configure the external user management.

This needs to be documented.
fields.summary: Document importing with external user management

fields.description: _mvn idea:idea_ erroneously detects web descriptors, as well incorrectly creates resource pattern.
fields.summary: Mvn idea:idea does not create project files correctly

fields.description: I'd like to see a scheduling option to poll for changes at specific times of day and kick off build only if changes are detected.
fields.summary: Add scheduling option to poll for changes at specific times

fields.description: I would like it if I could not only trigger additional build plan upon completion of a build, but to have another plan triggered before a build is started. An example would be having a build which wipes and re-images a box with a new database. I have a wipe image repository plan as a child plan of this since the 2 are linked, but I would like to be able to stop and start apache before the plan is being run so someone can't accidentially hit the database or image repository when this build is going on. I currently have to manually stop apache before and restart after. It seems that Bamboo should be able to take care of this. I don't want to run a stopApache plan everytime which triggers the db build -> wipe images -> start apache. I would like to have the database build as the one that is clicked. Also, conditionals for plans to execute when a build fails would be useful.
fields.summary: The ability to run a plan before a build in dependencies

fields.description: Currently, they just indicate "No failed tests found, a possible compilation error."
fields.summary: Builds that fail due to being manually stopped should indicate this in their failure reason

fields.description:
The atlassian-ide-plugin sent me to this URL: 
https://jira2.bamboo.atlassian.com/browse/JIRAPROFTEST-DEF-null

Bamboo reported this as an "Internal server error", giving me a stacktrace and suggesting I raise a support request.

This is a user error that should just show a simple error page.
fields.summary: Bamboo should handle "No page associated with this URI" in a more graceful way.

fields.description:
When specifying an Test Result directory other than **/tesr-results/* this directory is  not persisted when returning to the edit mask - **/tesr-results/* appears again in the field.
I have found that the value entered is written to the database but not correctly loaded.
fields.summary: Build Configuration | Builder | Test Result Directory not persisted for Bash (Command type)

fields.description:
It is possible to use globale variables in the Repository URL field, but not in the Web Repository URL.

See the attachments.


Actually I would like to be able to "reuse" a project, like a project template, and set different variables, like my
release-branch variable.  Then it would be possible to build againts several branches, with the same Bamboo project.
fields.summary: Allow global variables to be Web Repository URLs

fields.description:
for example : http://panda:8080/bamboo/browse/BAM-NIGHTSTB-185

|Web repository url|https://svn.atlassian.com/atlaseye/browse/bamboo|

| ||current||correct||
||changes | atlaseye/browse/*atlassian*/bamboo | https://svn.atlassian.com/atlaseye/browse/bamboo/branches/...|
||changelog | atlaseye/changelog?cs= | https://svn.atlassian.com/atlaseye/changelog/bamboo/?cs=68859 |
||SVN|https://svn.atlassian.com/svn/private/atlassian/bamboo/branches/atlassian_bamboo_2_1_branch||

problem how links are assembled in the changed file list in the build summary | changes tab

It seems that the svn repository url is inserted.

This happens if the fisheye base directory is different from the svn base directory.
fields.summary: A Build's change file list does not produce the correct links to fisheye in bamboo 2.2 snapshot

fields.description: There is limited information portrayed in these IMs at the moment.  It would be good to revisit what goes in them.
fields.summary: Improve Build Completed IM Content

fields.description: Notifications when you've labelled a build
fields.summary: Build Labelled Notification

fields.description:
Now that we have an event thrown when a build hangs, we should provide better ways to utilise this such as
* Providing a build hung specific plugin point (as opposed to just an event listener)
** Includes UI Plugin point next to the "configure build hung details"
* Make it so that you can run a command when a build has hung (either as a plugin or hard coded)
fields.summary: Build Hung Plugin Point / Build Hung Events

fields.description:
Give a better indication of what is going on with a larger variety of icons.

Couple of use cases

1) Your plan can't access the repository, you can't tell looking at the plan/dashboard that it has even tried to build in a long time.
2) Differentiating between build queued, executing and hung.
fields.summary: Have a greater variety of states depicted by the dashboard Icons
Typo in LocalBuildResultProcessor 'Ignoriing'

fields.description:
source repository aliases are already assigned to users for internal user management within bamboo BAM-770.
This should be applied to users that are managed externally in crowd as well.
fields.summary: if user management is handled by crowd - the username should also be applied to the source repository alias in the user's profile

fields.description: It should be possible to define on which day the backup should start. This means that you can configure a backup on monday, that should run every week on saturday.
fields.summary: Deine a specific day in a week, when Backup should start

fields.description:
There's a couple of builds on JBAC2 (some of the branch builds), where we switched from the 3.12 branch of the JIRA source to the 3.13 branch.  The builds configuration reports the source path correctly as 3.13.  However when you look in the actual build directory on the server, 'svn info' shows that the build is still building the 3.12 branch.

This seems to be true for scheduled builds (such as https://jira2.bamboo.atlassian.com/browse/JIRAFUNCBRA-JDK14) and builds that have run on remote agents (the source on the remote agent's box is still from the old branch). Since we'll end up testing the wrong source without knowing this is pretty bad!
fields.summary: Scheduled builds and builds running on remote agents don't seem to switch to a new source root in the build directory

fields.description:
The log is littered with showLatestBuildStatus.action messages:

2008-10-20 16:03:01,475 INFO [http-1990-Processor22] [AccessLogFilter] admin http://localhost:1990/bamboo/ajax/showLatestBuildStatus.action?buildKey=TEST-DEF 74425kb
2008-10-20 16:03:11,520 INFO [http-1990-Processor25] [AccessLogFilter] admin http://localhost:1990/bamboo/ajax/showLatestBuildStatus.action?buildKey=TEST-DEF 73292kb
2008-10-20 16:03:21,581 INFO [http-1990-Processor22] [AccessLogFilter] admin http://localhost:1990/bamboo/ajax/showLatestBuildStatus.action?buildKey=TEST-DEF 72164kb
2008-10-20 16:03:31,642 INFO [http-1990-Processor25] [AccessLogFilter] admin http://localhost:1990/bamboo/ajax/showLatestBuildStatus.action?buildKey=TEST-DEF 79398kb
2008-10-20 16:03:41,671 INFO [http-1990-Processor22] [AccessLogFilter] admin http://localhost:1990/bamboo/ajax/showLatestBuildStatus.action?buildKey=TEST-DEF 78358kb
2008-10-20 16:03:51,717 INFO [http-1990-Processor25] [AccessLogFilter] admin http://localhost:1990/bamboo/ajax/showLatestBuildStatus.action?buildKey=TEST-DEF 77131kb
fields.summary: Logging too verbose

fields.description:
Make JiraPlugin more robust against null entries in plans that are obtained from a plankey and jira project key association. Handle null as plan obtained from a plan key.

{code}
Stack Trace:

java.lang.NullPointerException
at com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.jiraPlugin.actions.ajax.ViewPlanStatusByJiraKey.findLatestReleventBuild(ViewPlanStatusByJiraKey.java:83)
at com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.jiraPlugin.actions.ajax.ViewPlanStatusByJiraKey.execute(ViewPlanStatusByJiraKey.java:66)
{code}
fields.summary: NPE in Jiraplugin if  Plans derived from jira project are null

fields.description:
Allow the ability to set a specific time period at which time users are forced to refresh their passwords. For some companies the need to keep data secure is paramount. Forcing staff to keep passwords changed is a difficult task and thus having this feature would prevent any problems with a potential inadvertent access.

Crowd sets an attribute in the request that is send to the remote webapp. This request among other things specifies that the web app needs to reset the password. However, it is up to the web app to enforce that attribute and enforce resetting of the password.
fields.summary: CLONE -Allow for password change enforcement

fields.description:
Hi,

In my humble opinion, one thing that is missing for the moment in Bamboo is the ability to display a synthetic dashboard with the statistics of the project : code coverage, findbugs, pmd etc... 

Maybe a new tab in the dashboard with some extension points that other plugins can use to display their own data, allowing the dashboard and bamboo to stay independent on the statistics provider. 

There is some other tools that provide such a dashboard, for example sonar : http://nemo.sonar.codehaus.org/ and it's quite useful to have this kind of data on the dashboard (plus an additionnal chart of the statistics evolution in time).

Is it relevant or not ?
fields.summary: Extending dashboard to present reporting on the project

fields.description: From http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?threadID=29316&tstart=0
fields.summary: Map multiple repository aliases users to one Bamboo user

fields.description: The Perforce changelists returns all files that have been changed within a workspace... however, if the workspace itself has changed - Bamboo doesn't pick this up.
fields.summary: Bamboo should check for workspace changes, when checking for code changes.

fields.description: I have (on purpose) committed code that does not compile. I accessed the build from the IntelliJ connector and to my surprise, Bamboo gave me failed tests list! The failed tests were tests from teh last build that _did_ compile.
fields.summary: Bamboo API returns "last failed tests" instead of "failed tests from last build"

fields.description:
Not sure the best way to implement this but I would like to have a daily or cron build strategy that only triggers if another build is currently not failing.

At the moment my daily build has to be triggered manually which isn't ideal as it should be done out of hours, the only other alternative is to set it as a daily build. However if one of our other commit builds is not completing then the daily build will always fail. This fills up the bamboo screen and out email boxes with fails as well as having other disadvantages.
fields.summary: Option to have a build that only runs when another build is not failing

fields.description:
Since recently there were fixes of some issues with non-authorized access to plan artifacts now we have a problem with downloading artifact from one of our Linux machine. Usually we type something like "wget http://host:8085/download/NGA-BETA46/artifacts/build-17/ROOT.war" and download the build, but now we get 403 HTTP error: "You do not have access to the plan NGA-BETA46" for this URL. We agree that it's fine to have such secure there, but we would ask you about one improvement.

It would be very convenient for us if you could improve Bamboo so we could provide the Bamboo's username and password to this utility just like "wget --user=%username% --password=%password% http://host:8085/download/NGA-BETA46/artifacts/build-17/ROOT.war". So in other words, allow Bamboo to get login information from HTTP GET header this utility sends to server.

Or probably you have any ideas of how we can download plans artifacts from our unix machine (there's no X-terminal there). Your assistance will be very much appreciated. 

Thanks in advance.
fields.summary: Allow 'wget' unix utility to access plan's artifacts by providing username and password

fields.description:
At the moment it is only possible to add build plans to one or more agents.

I would be nice it is possible to priorize the agents a build plan is running on.
For Example:

Plan1 is configured to run on Agent1 with high priority and on Agent2 with low priority.
This should mean that whenever Plan1 will be executed, Bamboo checks if the Agent with the highest priority is available. If this is so than the build will start on this Agent. If this is not than Bamboo should go down the next lower priority agent to run on.
fields.summary: Execute Build Plans on different Agents with an Agent Priorities

fields.description: The JIRA-Bamboo plugin on the JIRA server has corrupted image files.
fields.summary: The Bamboo icons on the JIRA builds tab are corrupted.

fields.description: We need to ensure that our Bamboo export mapper code is null safe.. often we just assume data to be there and if its null then the export fails.
fields.summary: Export of cusom data is not null safe

fields.description: Formatting of the reason field "Updated by ..." (Agent's last activities panel) should be changed. Right now, it is double hyperlinked. {code:xml} Updated byjgorycki, wseliga, jjaroczynski {code} Affected files: * bamboo-core/src/main/resources/com/atlassian/bamboo/build/triggerReasons/codeChangedTriggerReason-short.ftl * bamboo-web-app/src/main/webapp/fragments/buildResults/buildResultsTable.ftl Originally raised as a part of BAM-3002. For it affects bamboo internal interfaces, on Mark request it has been moved to a separate Jira task.
fields.summary: Changing the way the "Updated by" text field is being constructed

fields.description:
Currently, if a plan is protected by permissioning - and anonymous user access is turned off there is no way to automate the artifact download via a script.

We should have a REST API to download artifacts.
fields.summary: Ability to download artifact via the REST API
Set up tunnels for VCS traffic

fields.description:
I implemented new feature in IntelliJ Connector which shows information about build ownership (details at https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/PL-683).
To get this work I had to extend _getLatestBuildResults.action_ in Bamboo. _macros.ftl_ is the only changed file. 
Please apply attached patch to the Bamboo with above change (created on rev68276).
fields.summary: Apply patch which sends list of commiters

fields.description:
This request is as meant to be an easy implemented workaround for the functionality sought in BAM-1850.

The table on the Completed Builds page should have a column listing the Jira issues that relate to that build.  The cells in that column would display the same information that appears on the All Plans dashboard page, i.e. something like "Relates to: ABC-123,ABC-456  Fixes: ABC-789".
fields.summary: Completed Builds page should show links to Jira issues

fields.description:
In 2.2 there is the functionality to send notifications when people comment on builds etc.  We have, for the moment, set it to NOT notify the user that made the comment. It would be good if this was an option similar to JIRA ("Notify me when I make changes").

The main issue surrounding this is that you can add comments/labels from your IM, so its a bit weird to get the comment/label sent straight back to you.
fields.summary: Option to turn notifications due to my actions on/off

fields.description:
In the build results screen the Tests tab displays links to test cases.
If the link contains utf8 and '+' the link does not work. For example:
http://localhost:8080/bamboo/browse/AIS-DEF-26/test/%D0%9D%D0%B0%D0%B1%D0%BE%D1%80+%D1%82%D0%B5%D1%81%D1%82%D0%BE%D0%B2
fields.summary: Bamboo does not link urls with utf8 and "+" character for test cases

fields.description:
The utf8 representation of the build plan does not appear correctly on the dashboard as a build name.
 ???? ????????? ????? - ???????? ??????: Plan Summary is displayed instead
fields.summary: Bamboo does not handle utf8 (russian) correctly for <buildName>Проверка логина</buildName>

fields.description:
I am searching for a quick solution to recreate a set of Build Plan from a Bamboo 1.2.3 with MySQL into a Bambo 2.1.2 with Oracle.

* Does script capcities exist, such Jelly under JIRA ?
* Is there some other possibilities with Remote APIs ? sample would be welcome !

Rgds
Vincent
fields.summary: Be able to create Project and Build Plan by script

fields.description:
This would allow for intermediate results to be available to other dependent builds. once a remote agent is chosen for the first build, all the related builds need to run on the same agent.
A possible scenario:
Plan B is a child of plan A.
Plan A uses maven to install a WAR in its local repository.
Plan B re-uses this WAR and saves resources.

http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?threadID=29022&tstart=0
fields.summary: Allow forcing dependent plans to run on the same agent

fields.description: When editing permissions you can only add 1 user at a time but the user picker lets you pick many, then once you submit the form it yells at you.
fields.summary: User Picker for build permissions lets you 2 when you can only add 1

fields.description: Due to Sun's DLJ license, we need to prevent third parties from using the JDK installed in the EC2 image unless they have accepted Bamboo's EULA.
fields.summary: System will not allow anyone to use the default Elastic Bamboo image unless instantiated by Bamboo server

fields.description:
We need a new EULA for Bamboo 2.2, incorporating:
# The terms required by Sun's [DLJ license|http://download.java.net/dlj/DLJ-v1.1.pdf], and
# Any terms required relating to Bamboo's use of the customer's EC2 account.
fields.summary: New EULA

fields.description:
It is nice to have additional information in Bamboo messages in case of failures.

For example, if compile fails, it is possible to send part of error log in mail to help identify issues without navigating to the web site.

The same can be done in case of tests failures, i.e. provide some details about failed tests. It is even simpler since failed test data available for Bamboo in XML.
fields.summary: Include failure details into Bamboo mail notification

fields.description:
Currently Bamboo sends plain-text messages not always well displayed in some mail apps (like Outlook).

It is really nice to have an option to get well formatted HTML messages. The same way how it is done in JIRA.
fields.summary: Send Bamboo messages as HTML formatted mails

fields.description:
Consider the following string:
{code}MAVEN_OPTS="-Xmx1280m -XX:MaxPermSize=512m" JAVA_HOME="/opt/java/jre/1.5" {code}

the splitEnvironments() method in the Command Class tries to be smart an not split on space within the quotes.  However, it greedily matches for quotes so it will pick up:
"-Xmx1280m -XX:MaxPermSize=512m" JAVA_HOME="/opt/java/jre/1.5" 
as the quoted string and not split spaces rather than:
"-Xmx1280m -XX:MaxPermSize=512m"

So the above string wont get split into its two properties, and the build dies...
fields.summary: System Environment Variable Parsing Error

fields.description: Currently bamboo uses svnkit 1.1.8,  Bamboo does not run with svnkit 2.1x
fields.summary: Bamboo to fully support SVN server version 1.5x and svnkit 1.2x

fields.description: The default for new users seems to be no notification. As admin, I'd like to either be able to set the default notification prefs for new users or be able to edit an individual user's prefs from the admin interface. As is stands, our users don't know if they broke the build by default.
fields.summary: Abilit to set default notification for new plans

fields.description: Our builders sometimes get stuck and builds need to be manually stopped. It would be great if the bar graphs on the plan summary showed a mark for builds that were manually stopped so it's easier to locate builds that have useful failure information in their logs.
fields.summary: Stopped builds should have a different status

fields.description:
More often then I would like, one or more of our build agents dies/croaks/barfs/quits for unknown or unexpected reasons.  When this occurs, our CI builds will remain green (or red) and display a spinning build icon, as opposed to a check mark.  After a bit of time (usually way longer than I'd like) someone notices that the builds have not recently completed, or done anything for that matter.  Only after you click on a build are you then notified that:

No agents can run this build.

But what?  I was just looking at a spinning icon, is Bamboo confused, or just trying to confuse users?

I would suggest that if a build is in a state of "No agents can run this build" it gets a new icon, other than a spinning arrow, perhaps one which conveys some sense of urgency and concern.  Like a yellow triangle or similar.
fields.summary: Currently building icon misleading for queued builds with no available agents
Dashboard Ajax update not updating full row

fields.description:
In case the format of the "Job Line:" section is different an exception is thrown. 
{noformat}
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2008/09/28 22:28:11 | 2008-09-28 22:28:11,354 DEBUG [btpool0-4] [ChangelistBuilder] Job Line: VCL-2 on 2008/09/25
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2008/09/28 22:28:11 | 2008-09-28 22:28:11,354 ERROR [btpool0-4] [ChangelistBuilder] Exception: null
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2008/09/28 22:28:11 | 2008-09-28 22:28:11,354 ERROR [btpool0-4] [PerforceManager] Could retrieve change lists from perforce
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2008/09/28 22:28:11 | com.tek42.perforce.PerforceException: Failed to retrieve changelist.
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2008/09/28 22:28:11 | 	at com.tek42.perforce.parse.ChangelistBuilder.build(ChangelistBuilder.java:171)
{noformat}

||desired format| VCL-2 on 2008/09/25 by bob *closed*|
||deviation|VCL-2 on 2008/09/25 | 
In the deviation the last 3 tokens are missing.

We should be more tolerant towards missing tokens.
fields.summary: Changelist parser com.tek42.perforce.parse.ChangelistBuilder is intolerant to deviations in the changelist text file format

fields.description:
The XML parser that runs amidst the upgrade process makes the upgrade fail if there was a corrupt (truncated) XML document. 
Empty xml files are skipped for instance - so truncated files should be skipped as well or their contents should be erased or something...
fields.summary: Make XML parsing more robust for upgrade tasks

fields.description: Specification:  http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Elastic+Bamboo+-+Security+Architecture
fields.summary: Secure connection from Elastic Agents to Bamboo Server

fields.description:
Bamboo work great for a while, i have this error now.  It reported out of disk space but my build happen on drive D.  So is there a bug that some how bamboo look into C drive and say it out of space? log and disk usage below.  Thanks for the help.

fields.summary: Bamboo can't update source -

fields.description: If you type in the "editProfile" url when you are not logged in bamboo errors and tells you that you do not have permission to edit the profile.  Instead it should just give you the option to log in.
fields.summary: Incorrect error for editProfile when not logged in

fields.description: Artifacts should be available from the standard /browse/BAM-MAIN-122/artifact/myartifact ... URL pattern.
fields.summary: Access artifacts from the standard "pretty" URL

fields.description:
Trigger reason text sometimes ends in a '.' and sometimes doesn't.  This makes pages such as the view build results page look bizarre as it uses:
 <trigger reason>, <relative time>

See attached screen shot.
fields.summary: Build results summary page relies on specific punctation in trigger reason.

fields.description:
The current version of jetty-6.1.5.jar does not allow to configure forward proxying. According to step 5 in http://docs.codehaus.org/display/JETTY/Configuring+mod_proxy {code}...
  <Call name="addConnector">
    <Arg>
      <New class="org.mortbay.jetty.nio.SelectChannelConnector">
        <Set name="port">8080</Set>
        <Set name="forwarded">true</Set>
        <Set name="hostHeader">example.com:81</Set>
      </New>
    </Arg>
  </Call>
  ...{code}
can be used in jetty.xml to configure jetty behind a proxy.
This method is only available from jetty version 6.1.12 onwards.
fields.summary: ship a later version of jetty with bamboo-std to allow forward proxying

fields.description:
In the Create New Plan section of Bamboo, in section 1 "Plan Details", the description associated with "Build Plan Key" reads:
"This is the key for the plan which must unique within a project. "

If you read it carefully you'll discover it's missing a verb... it should read "This is the key for the plan which must BE unique within a project"....
fields.summary: Sentence incomplete in Plan Details -> Build Plan Key description

fields.description:
I use a a Windows Server 2003 virtual machine as a remote build agent for my linux bamboo server.

I am seeing sporadic failures of the agent with a JMSEexception. Once the exception occurs, the build agent appears to hang and I have to restart it to continue working:

2008-09-25 10:14:51,168 INFO [KRW-COVERAGE:Output Pump] [StreamToLogsPumper] Failed to pump input stream
org.springframework.jms.UncategorizedJmsException: Uncategorized exception occured during JMS processing; nested exception is javax.jms.JMSException: Wire format negociation timeout: peer did not send his wire format.; nested exception is java.io.IOException: Wire format negociation timeout: peer did not send his wire format.
Caused by: 
javax.jms.JMSException: Wire format negociation timeout: peer did not send his wire format.

I have not observed any pattern that seems to cause this failure, but it has happened at least once per week in the last month. I am attaching a snippet of the build agent logs. Please let me know if there are other logs (perhaps from the server) I could attach that would help investigate this.
fields.summary: Build agent fails sporadically with UncategorizedJmsException

fields.description:
If i leave the SMTP username and password fields empty and then click save the fields are saved with the current username and not with an empty value.

I can't seem to find a way to save empty username and password fields for the SMTP server.
fields.summary: Can't save empty SMTP username and password

fields.description:
We currently have 2 build servers, a 1.x and a 2.x server.
The 2.x server uses remote agents for doing builds for other (then the bamboo server that is) platforms.
The 1.x server has a lot of local build queues for managing simultaneous builds.

We are considering using 2.x with a single server and using remote agents as a way to scale, but our hesitation is that the remote agents don't appear to be able to run multiple simultaneous builds.  It appears this is not an option with 2.x, so for scaling purposes we couldn't have more than 25 builds going at a time (plus local builds on the bamboo server itself).  With some of our CIT builds taking quite some time, that's a severe restriction in our environment (at least as we currently understand things).
fields.summary: Remote Agents able to perform simultaneous builds

fields.description:
When a build fails from a unit test failure, the email notification should include which unit tests failed.

The existing email notification only includes the changes (which are usually meaningless since you also don't what the actual changes were, until you log into the bamboo server).

Changes should be, email notifications should have options to show/hide:
- the files changes
- the unit tests that failed (and optionally the failure stacktrace or any other info the test has).


This would save me tons of time as I wouldn't have to log into the bamboo machine to figure out exactly what went wrong, since the email would have that info already.
fields.summary: Bamboo email notifications should include the unit tests that failed

fields.description:
svn 1.5.1.  

# Bamboo builds my project fine.  
# Do a manual {{svn update}} in the build dir
# Bamboo no longer builds, stating {{Caused by: org.tmatesoft.svn.core.SVNException: svn: This client is too old to work with working copy '/path/to/webapps/atlassian-bamboo/data/current/xml-data/build-dir/COREI1-STAGE'; please get a newer Subversion client}}

It seems that this is because some meta data gets changed in the checkout dir by my manual interaction and the default SVN builder can't deal with it.  

Now, not only is this silly (all I'm asking is for it to {{svn update}} and it needs an exact version match?!?!?), but the error message gives almost no indication of the problem.
fields.summary: if svn update in build dir; bamboo refuses to checkout/build

fields.summary: BAM: Report artifact directory which is in error as well as pattern.

fields.description:
Currently in viewing a test plan, under the "Tests" heading, there are four tabs:

Top 10 Most Failing Tests
Top 10 Longest to Fix Tests
Top 10 Longest Running Tests
Number of Tests

I would suggest a fifth tab, Top 10 Longest Running Successful Tests. We have several test plans and name them by how "hardened" the test is. Once a test has successfully run for 10 days we move it into a different test plan - a test plan with a higher expectation that it will not fail.

Having this new tab would give us a snapshot view of which tests are passing and which of those are the oldest - in other words, candidate tests to be moved up.
fields.summary: Top 10 Longest Running Successful Tests

fields.description:
If there are several build placed in the queue it is useful to see in  which order they are going to start the actual build execution. This would make project/builds summary page ('start.action') much more informative. It is especially important when Bamboo configured to perform many different builds.

There is a complexity here as described by Ajay

{quote}
I don't think that is actually possible - although the builds are placed in the queue, there is no way to forsee the agent that will build the plan.

For e.g, Plan A and B are triggered and is place in the queue, Plan A can be built by agent A and Plan B can be built by agent B - here, the order in which plans get executed are dependent upon which of the either agents A and B becomes available first. 
{quote}

but if there are 2 build plans waiting for the same agents it is possible to "predict" the order. If build plans are dependent on different agents it is more complex to predict but still possible somehow using build time statistics (i.e. estimate how long specific agent will work on its build and find what is the build it will pick up then).
fields.summary: Show build order for builds in progress on project/builds summary page

fields.description: Currently Bamboo shows build reason for the last completed builds on project/builds summary page ('start.action'). I.e. which change has triggered a build. It is useful but it is also useful (probably even more) to see on the same page what was triggered build currently in progress (executed or placed in the queue).
fields.summary: Show build reason on project/builds summary page for build currently in progress

fields.description:
Currently project/builds summary ('start.action') page doesn't show how long specific build is being built and only previous build time shown there.

It might be very useful to see the build time updated with the page.
fields.summary: Show build time on project/builds summary page

fields.description:
The start() method in BambooContainer.java is responsible for starting the containers components.

If something goes wrong and (See, BAM-2921) the entire Bamboo app hangs and there is no indication of what went wrong.
fields.summary: Bamboo server hangs if Container intialization fails

fields.description:
Currently, there are 2 build states (Pass and Fail) - Bamboo will automaticaly fail builds if the compilation is successful and the tests fail. 

We should have a third build state (and perhaps a different color on the dashboard? ), as this saves the user time investigating why the build failed.

Raised from http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257289400#257289400
fields.summary: Third build state, when builds have passed but tests have failed.

fields.description:
Improve the documentation for [Integrating Bamboo with LDAP|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/5.13.2+Integrating+Bamboo+with+LDAP].

Improvements:
* Create a new section or sub-page to clearly distinguish instructions for external user management, versus the LDAP integration instructions above it.
* Simplify the introductory paragraph to this page. There is too much confusing content up front, which discusses user management, when it should basically say that this page is to connect Bamboo to an LDAP. The other scenarios can be described in the new section/sub-page.
* Describe clearly what the 'read-only external management' flag does --- it makes the Bamboo users and groups read-only, the implication being that you will be managing your users and groups externally.
* Describe our recommended settings for the 'read-only external management' flag --- i.e. reference [this page|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/5.13.1+Integrating+Bamboo+with+Crowd] more clearly or excerpt it.
fields.summary: Improve Integrating Bamboo with LDAP page

fields.description: If an admin updates a user's details, that user's notification preferences will reset to "Both IM & Email"
fields.summary: Admins updating a user resets the notification preferences

fields.description:
Guys,

When trying to add my jabber details to BDAC I get the following exception:
{noformat}
om.atlassian.core.exception.InfrastructureException: Application "devsuite-bamboo" does not allow user modifications
	at bucket.user.DefaultUserAccessor.saveUser(DefaultUserAccessor.java:228)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.user.BambooUserManagerImpl.saveUser(BambooUserManagerImpl.java:139)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.user.BambooUserManagerImpl.saveUser(BambooUserManagerImpl.java:123)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:585)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:304)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.invokeJoinpoint(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:182)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:149)
	at org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionInterceptor.invoke(TransactionInterceptor.java:106)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:204)
	at $Proxy6.saveUser(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.ww2.actions.admin.user.ConfigureUser.execute(ConfigureUser.java:82)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.ww2.actions.admin.user.ConfigureUser.doUpdateExternalUser(ConfigureUser.java:134)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:585)
{noformat}

External user management is marked as read-only but it still appears to be attempting to write to Crowd.
fields.summary: External User Management is marked as readonly but it is still attmepting to write to Crowd.
Upgrade to SVNKit 1.2 once its release.
Create a "How to persist plugin data in Bamboo" page to the plugin docs

fields.description:
Developer kit is no longer needed (we have the archetype instead)
So we should get rid of it.  Currently this is where the example plugins are however, so these should get put somewhere else.
fields.summary: Remove Developer Kit and Put example plugins somewhere else

fields.description:
See [Matt Doar's comment|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Bamboo+Remote+Agent+Installation+Guide?focusedCommentId=163940396#comment-163940396] on the Remote Agent Installation Guide, i.e.

_"I want to run a remote agent at startup of a machine, and I see a suggestion to consult OS docs for that. It would be more helpful to provide examples for Linux and Windows as JIRA and Confluence do."_
fields.summary: Add detailed examples on running a remote agent at the startup of a machine
Agents should have a config option to clean up the build when they're done to reclaim disk space.

fields.description:
Currently, the same broker URI must be used to bind the broker transport, and to connect to it from agents.

This prevents the failover transport from being used on the agents, as a failover scheme URI cannot be used to bind the Broker transport.

Bamboo should provide the ability to configure distinct broker URIs for binding the broker transport, and for connecting to the Broker from agents.
fields.summary: Support for distinct client and server broker URIs

fields.description:
From troy:

http://skitch.com/michaelstudman/ipdc/dashboard-atlassian-bamboo
fields.summary: No way to differentiate queued plans from running plans on dashboard

fields.description: http://localhost:8085/admin/chooseBuildsToMove.action has a warning box which refers to build queues. Link http://localhost:8085/admin/agent/configureAgents!default.action?returnUrl=/admin/chooseBuildsToMove.action is unresolved, action does not exist any more. This link should remove the selected (or) all plans that are queued or building at the moment.
fields.summary: Move Plan Wizard has wrong infromation and unresolved links / actions

fields.description: It would be nice if the logging level of AccessLogFilter was changed from INFO to DEBUG as it makes deciphering of bamboo issues difficult due to the sheer amount white noise.
fields.summary: Change logging level of AccessLogFilter from INFO to DEBUG

fields.description:
Bamboo currently automatically adds "wireFormat.maxInactivityDuration=0" to any Broker URL.  However, there are a few problems with its implementation:

# It ignores the transport being used, adding it even to transports that don't accept such a parameter.
# It discards some components of valid Broker URLs (e.g. using the failover scheme).
# It doesn't apply the parameter to nested URLs (e.g. tcp scheme URLs nested within a failover scheme URL.

This is preventing the use of the failover transport to solve BAM-2999.
fields.summary: Valid Broker URLs are ruined by attempt to add "maxInactivityDuration"
